Books#

Chapter detection and splitting for book-length PDFs.

class papercutter.books.splitter.Chapter[source]#

A detected chapter in a book.

title: str#
start_page: int#
end_page: int#
level: int = 1#
property page_count: int#

Number of pages in this chapter.

__init__(title, start_page, end_page, level=1)#
Parameters:

  • title (str)

  • start_page (int)

  • end_page (int)

  • level (int)

Return type:

None

class papercutter.books.splitter.ChapterSplitter[source]#

Detect and split chapters from book PDFs.

CHAPTER_PATTERNS = ['^Chapter\\s+(\\d+|[IVXLC]+)[:\\.\\s]', '^CHAPTER\\s+(\\d+|[IVXLC]+)[:\\.\\s]', '^Part\\s+(\\d+|[IVXLC]+)[:\\.\\s]', '^PART\\s+(\\d+|[IVXLC]+)[:\\.\\s]', '^(\\d+)\\.\\s+[A-Z]', '^Section\\s+(\\d+)']#
__init__(min_chapter_pages=3)[source]#

Initialize the chapter splitter.

Parameters:

min_chapter_pages (int) – Minimum pages for a valid chapter.

detect_chapters(pdf_path)[source]#

Detect chapters in a PDF using bookmarks and text patterns.

Tries bookmark/outline first, falls back to text pattern matching.

Parameters:

pdf_path (Path) – Path to the PDF file.

Return type:

list[Chapter]

Returns:

List of detected chapters.

get_chapter_text(pdf_path, chapter, max_chars=None)[source]#

Extract text for a specific chapter.

Parameters:

  • pdf_path (Path) – Path to the PDF file.

  • chapter (Chapter) – Chapter to extract.

  • max_chars (Optional[int]) – Maximum characters to extract (for LLM context limits).

Return type:

str

Returns:

Extracted chapter text.
